description: At 20 and in his first job, the young JS Bach got into such trouble that the only thing he could do was to walk away. JS Bach‚Äôs Long Walk in the Snow takes you along on that trip: a 400 km odyssey with street fights, big business, insight, fulfillment, the father figure he didn‚Äôt know he needed and, quite possibly, love. Join master storyteller Tom Allen and a brilliant musical cast of harpist Lori Gemmell, violinist Mark Fewer, singer Deantha Edmunds, bassist Jim Vivian and pianist Bill Brennan for an enthralling night of story and music.
name: Bach's Long Walk with Tom Allen and Friends

description:
The Best Kind Comedy Tour includes stand-up comedians Colin Hollett, Mike Lynch, and Brian Aylward.

Colin Hollett has become one of Newfoundland and Labrador‚Äôs go-to comedic voices. He is a former winner of the Great Canadian Laugh-Off and he had the highest-voted video in Canada for the Russel Peters BFF comedy competition. He headlines comedy clubs across Canada and internationally.

Star of The Outhouse TV, Mike Lynch has become a well-known face in Canadian comedy. His wide range of popular sketch characters has garnered over 10 million views online. His annual sketch and stand-up show ‚ÄúGetting To Know Me‚Äù continues to sell out all across Canada. Mike can be heard on Just For Laughs Originals on Sirius XM radio.

Brian Aylward has been a Comedian for 19 years, performing more than 3800 shows in 41 countries. Aylward is a former Canadian Comedy Award winner for ‚ÄúBest Standup Comic.‚Äù His numerous social media rants and sketch comedy character ‚ÄúFadder‚Äù have garnered millions of views online. Brian has appeared several times on CBC Radio‚Äôs ‚ÄúThe Debaters.‚Äù

His stand-up comedy special ‚ÄúBig In Asia‚Äù is on Amazon Prime.
name: Best Kind Comedy Tour 2024

description: Valmy is a singer-songwriter and multi-instrumentalist from Ontario who‚Äôs been following the ocean and making home on the East Coast. Exploring themes of wonder, loss, and healing, she uses her folk-influenced music to tell stories about loving and stumbling your way through the dark. Based in St. John‚Äôs, Newfoundland, Valmy creates and performs by weaving nature-inspired melodic swells and atmospheric harmonies with her contemplative writing. Her debut full-length album ‚ÄòThe In Between‚Äô was independently released in September 2023 and warmly received listeners, with a thoughtful review from Tony Ploughman of Fred‚Äôs Records: ‚ÄúThe rhythms and melodies wrap around the mind and soul like a lovingly patched quilt‚Ä¶ There is a cohesiveness to this full album offering meditative musings on balancing ones own mental state in harmony with nature, the songs providing a methodical process to achieve that balance. And the underlying intensity to follow through on the beckoning of one‚Äôs thoughts and emotions to create is constant‚Ä¶Deftly produced, engineered and mixed, ‚ÄúThe In Between‚Äù is one of 2023‚Äôs finest NL Releases‚Äù. Valmy concluded 2023 with two MusicNL nominations, was a 2024 East Coast Music Award nominee, and was also nominated for three 2024 MusicNL awards for Alternative Artist, Solo Artist, and Ron Hynes Songwriter of the Year. She is looking forward to sharing selections from her album and new original songs during this solo performance at Theatre Hill, before connecting with audiences on her Autumn Tour through Eastern Canada.
name: Valmy Live at Theatre Hill
